ee1cb8986c0c.description: We write down our mess, that we may marvel in what is same about us, wonder about what is different & embrace one another anyway without condition.

72168947bef4.bio: One part cyborg; two parts glorious mess.
72168947bef4.name: H. Nemesis Nyx

1a63cf04da58.bio: Perpetually three eighth notes shy of a homicide.
1a63cf04da58.name: Classical Sass

daa0aa08c599.bio: Trying to find my way again.
daa0aa08c599.name: Tre L. Loadholt

paragraphs.text: You know when you hit that threshold — that tipping point where “Fuck You” is burning the tip of your tongue?
paragraphs.name: abaf

paragraphs.text: Thank you so much for sharing this news with me Tre! I didn’t catch this on Medium and I’m so excited I’m speechless. I almost didn’t post this piece! I’m very grateful for Ms. Sass’s keen editor’s eye and for This Glorious Mess for sharing. And thank YOU Tre — your positive encouragement is important to me! ❤

The fact that I have to explain my behaviour is deeply upsetting. I feel a visceral resistance to addressing any aspect of this mess, but I also know that moving from resistance to acceptance requires a constant acknowledgement of each thought related to that internal pull of repulsion. In other words, it’s not about pretending things didn’t happen, and it’s not about trying to just ‘let it go’. Quite the contrary, moving from resistance to acceptance requires the repeated act of sitting with the emotional and mental chaos, meeting each retaliation head on, and giving each thought space to express itself.
paragraphs.name: a0aa

56339e7cb391.title: In writing, there is certainly a place for solitude and quiet self-reflection, but this community…

paragraphs.name: 5f56
paragraphs.text: In writing, there is certainly a place for solitude and quiet self-reflection, but this community has proven to me time again how important it is to join forces, spread love, and make space for our tribe of writers and feelers. Especially here and Now. I’m grateful to be a part of this. And Tre, your feedback is Timeless :)

paragraphs.name: 9b5d
paragraphs.text: Hello, Cristina Matteis. Sassy wanted to make sure you knew your piece made the Humans Tab of Medium’s homepage. Congratulations, love! Thank you again for allowing us to host it. 💙

paragraphs.name: 36f3
paragraphs.text: I can relate to right now I might just go puke.
It’s also pretty nice to not feel so alone at the moment so I thank you for that gift. The only thing here I wonder about is if you actually were who you are in those moments you think…

4866c882e5f.title: Cristina, I love that you wrote through this moment in the aftermath.

paragraphs.text: Cristina, I love that you wrote through this moment in the aftermath. I love that you laid, in printed verbs, your experience and the care that still reigns your choices and your perspective. I think your share here is beautiful. Thank you.
